alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 26 at 6:09AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...Strong Winds and Elevated Water Levels along the Southwest Coast Sunday Evening into Monday Afternoon... A strong front wrapping around a low in the Bering Sea will produce strong west winds beginning this evening and will continue into Monday afternoon for the Kuskokwim Delta area. Strong westerly winds may produce elevated water levels 1 to 3 feet above normal high tide levels especially along west facing coastlines with the highest water levels expected late tonight and Monday morning. Minor coastal erosion is possible as well as debris to washing up to the top of the beach. Ice along the coast particularly between Kipnuk to Kongiganak may pile up along the shoreline. The exact track that the low takes will produce large differences on what shorelines will receive the worst impacts. Equipment along or on the shoreline in the Kuskokwim Delta area should be moved to high ground if possible. Please continue to monitor this developing weather situation for the latest updates and possible warnings at: weather.gov/afc ER
